newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-CURCIC SAYS HE WANTS TO LEAVE VILLA.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-CURCIC SAYS HE WANTS TO LEAVE VILLA.

text.p: Sasa Curcic wants to leave premier league title chasers Aston Villa less than five months after his four million pounds sterling ($6.7 million) move from Bolton.
The Serb midfielder said on Friday he was unhappy at Villa Park and regretted leaving Bolton who were relegated to the first division last season.
"I want to leave Villa now," he said. "Leaving Bolton and joining Villa was the biggest mistake I have made in my life but it will be my last mistake. In future I will follow my heart.

"I am an emotional person and I am just not happy here at all. I can't help feeling I betrayed the Bolton fans by leaving a club where I was so happy. I just looked at the money and the glory of continuing to play in the premier league."
Villa manager Brian Little said he was "surpised and disappointed" by Curcic's disclosure.

"I'll have to sit down with him and thrash the whole matter out but he cost us four million pounds and I can tell him and any interested club that there are no circumstances in which he will be going anywhere for less than that.''
